intro: Kopsia terengganensis, commonly known as the Terengganu kopsia, is a flowering plant native to the Malaysian state of Terengganu. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features simple, opposite leaves and produces small, clustered flowers with four petals. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
